name: PROPOFOL

indications.text: propofol injectable emulsion intravenous general anesthetic sedation indicated :

contraindications.text: full prescribing information detailed dosing instructions . ( 2 )

warningsAndPrecautions: propofol injectable emulsion usp , 10 mg per ml supplied sterile , white , homogeneous emulsion filled clear glass vial . available follows : product code strength ndc code description 1188 200 mg per 20 ml ( 10 mg per ml ) ndc 80830-1188-7 20 ml ready-to-use single-dose infusion vial packages 10 . 2364 500 mg per 50 ml ( 10 mg per ml ) ndc 80830-2364-8 50 ml ready-to-use single-dose infusion vial packages 20 . 2365 1,000 mg per 100 ml ( 10 mg per ml ) ndc 80830-2365-7 100 ml ready-to-use single-dose infusion vial packages 10. store 4° 25°c ( 40° 77°f ) . freeze . shake well .
adverseReactions: propofol injectable emulsion contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity propofol propofol injectable emulsion components . propofol injectable emulsion contraindicated patients history anaphylaxis eggs , egg products , soybeans soy products .
indications_original: Propofol injectable emulsion is an intravenous general anesthetic and sedation drug indicated for:
contraindications_original: See Full Prescribing Information for detailed dosing instructions. ( 2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Propofol Injectable Emulsion USP, 10 mg per mL is supplied as a sterile, white, homogeneous emulsion filled in clear glass vial.
                  It is available as follows:
                  
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                              
                                 Product Code
                              
                           
                           
                              
                                 Strength
                              
                           
                           
                              
                                 NDC Code
                              
                           
                           
                              
                                 Description
                              
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              1188
                           
                           
                              200 mg per 20 mL
                              (10 mg per mL)
                           
                           
                              NDC 80830-1188-7
                           
                           
                              20 mL ready-to-use single-dose infusion vial in packages of 10.
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              2364
                           
                           
                              500 mg per 50 mL
                              (10 mg per mL)
                           
                           
                              NDC 80830-2364-8
                           
                           
                              50 mL ready-to-use single-dose infusion vial in packages of 20.
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              2365
                           
                           
                              1,000 mg per 100 mL
                              (10 mg per mL)
                           
                           
                              NDC 80830-2365-7
                           
                           
                              100 mL ready-to-use single-dose infusion vial in packages of 10.
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  Store between 4° to 25°C (40° to 77°F). Do not freeze. Shake well before use.
adverseReactions_original:
Propofol injectable emulsion is contraindicated in patients with a known hypersensitivity to propofol or any of propofol injectable emulsion components.
                  Propofol injectable emulsion is contraindicated in patients with a history of anaphylaxis to eggs, egg products, soybeans or soy products.
